extendedInfo.description: The AR (Augmented Reality) Sudoku Solver is a tech demo that uses the phone's camera to find sudoku grids, solve them and project the results back into the picture.The program expects the grid to be freestanding, flat and not manually filled.Best results are achieved in good lightning conditions. The solver does not try to solve grids with less than 20 symbols (not restricted to numbers). All symbols must appear at least once.Use the volume keys to toggle debug visualizations.This is not a game, just a tech demo without any practical application that I know of.

reviews.title: Fun and effective
reviews.comment: Worked very well on my Samsung galaxy note : ) would be good to have a \'pause\' for the picture so you can look at the solution easily e.g. on a train. Thanks very much, hope it was fun to write : )
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs improvement
reviews.comment: This app lacks features like pausing the solution and flash to solve sudokus in the dark. Check out Realtime sudoku solver. Good improvement over this one.
reviews.author: Suriya Narayanan

reviews.title: Is not working
reviews.comment: I have samsung galaxy grand. There is no dedicated key for camera.  So how do I take the pic. If this app works then it is an amazing app. Give a touch screen capture option. Please reply. Thanking you. :(
reviews.author: Sai Akhil

reviews.title: It works on Samsung galaxy s2
reviews.comment: I got this to work fine on a standard newspaper sodoku,  but i had trouble getting it to work on a sodoku book.  It appears that the app had trouble recognising certain numbers such as 1 and 7.  A better UI could be added to include a \'freeze screen\'  button (easier than using two fingers to tap screen).  Other than that this application rocks!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent! - HTC Desire S
reviews.comment: It just works! Fantastic.. If you\'re a cheat :)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Absolutely Freaking Amazing!
reviews.comment: The first AR app that has worked on my phone!  Now I can tell my friends, \"So you think your phone is cool? Well mine\'s MAGIC. Check this out bro...\"  Very amazed.  I would give it ten stars, if I could!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: One of the most genius apps I\'ve ever seen.
reviews.comment: I strongly recommend it. Just would suggest add a snapshot mode to capture the solved matrix for later visualization.
reviews.author: Pedro Dinis Ferreira

reviews.title: A must try :)
reviews.comment: Really great app, solved a puzzle almost instantly. It may not be perfect at the moment, but it really does what it says :)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great.
reviews.comment: Excellent use of OCR. A snapshot feature would be very useful.  The red means the camera doesn\'t have a good picture or the puzzle is not recognized.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Would give it 5 stars if you could snapshot the solution. Otherwise very impressive
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Does what it says, very cool!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy S II X (T989)
reviews.comment: Works great on galaxy II 2 x (T989) would be nice if you could screen capture. The solved answers flash a bit
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Cool!
reviews.comment: Mostly used for impressing people :)  Doesn\'t work every time though...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Lag? Blame your phone, not the app.
reviews.comment: Yes, it lags on powerful phones. It\'s a fact. Suck it up. It can be picky about puzzles, but once you get the hang of it? AMAZING!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It\'s Freaky!
reviews.comment: This is very impressive for an app that hasn\'t been updated in almost a year.  At first I thought it was a prank until I found an online Sudoku with nice big bold numbers, and it works very well with that, printed or on screen.  The numbers are legible enough to see the solution is correct, and it happens in an instant. Wouldn\'t it be cool to have a similar App that analyzes a chess game? Or scores games like Carcassonne! This app Force Closes and corrupts the Camera requiring a soft reset (an OS issue?  Who knows), so I can\'t rate it very high, but I can\'t uninstall it just yet, either. Excuse me while I go blow people\'s minds. Acer A500.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Lots of potential
reviews.comment: This app could be great, but due to bad documentation, bad UI, and unreliability, it is unusable. I got it to work once out of the 20 or so times that I tried it, and even then, the results were displayed for about half a second before disappearing. It would\'ve been helpful if the app asked me to save a screenshot with the results so that I don\'t have to keep holding the phone in the air!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pretty darn awesome
reviews.comment: The only way it could be better would be if you could take a freeze frame to see the results better, and maybe export/save the results.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Would be great to be able to \'freeze frame\' so I could copy the solution back to paper.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Motorola xoom
reviews.comment: Excellent good work
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Just an experimental demo. But screen all red, difficult capture, and solutions not accurate. Google goggles solves sudoku.
reviews.author: A Google User
